Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the reason why the babbitt of a turbine journal bearing is relieved at the point of oil entry along the horizontal joint?
Answer_1: To prevent oil from backing up in the supply line.
Answer_2: To permit oil to discharge through the rear of the bearing.
Answer_3: To prevent hydraulic pressure buildup when the journal rotates.
Answer_4: To permit the rotor journal to draw oil around the shaft.

Question_Title: Stack type air heaters are bypassed when a vessel is in port in order to prevent __________.
Answer_1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Answer_2: interference with the operation of the soot blowers
Answer_3: corrosion of the heater due to the low stack temperatures
Answer_4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question_Title: When boiler fires begin sputtering, indicating water in the fuel oil settling tank, you should __________.
Answer_1: start the alternate fuel oil service pump
Answer_2: shift to the service pump low suction
Answer_3: change suction to the alternate settling tank
Answer_4: reduce the fuel pump operating speed

Question_Title: The following information was recorded after a recent L.P. turbine bearing installation.  The bearing temperature was  logged at the indicated time intervals as:; ; 1200-110F(43C); 1210-123F(51C); 1220-136F(58C); 1230-149F(65C); 1240-153F(67C); 1250-155F(68C); 1300-155F(68C); ; The shaft RPM and lube oil cooler outlet temperature remained constant. The readings indicate __________.
Answer_2: water in the lube oil system

Question_Title: In an emergency, an auxiliary turbine can be stopped by __________.
Answer_2: actuating the throttle hand tripping device
Answer_3: rotating the hand lube oil pump backwards
Answer_4: increasing the load on the driven unit

Question_Title: One function of the air and flue gas bypass dampers installed in regenerative type air heaters is to __________.
Answer_1: avoid excessive cooling of the stack gases during low load  operation
Answer_2: regulate combustion air temperature at normal firing rates
Answer_3: reduce the load on the element drive motor
Answer_4: reduce the temperature of the double undulated heating elements

Question_Title: The safety valve nominal size for propulsion boilers and superheaters must be not less than 1 1/2 inches and not more than 4 inches.  The term 'nominal size' refers to the __________.
When the fires begin to sputter, you should __________.
Answer_3: take suction from another settling tank

Question_Title: A regenerative type air heater should be bypassed at low load in order to __________.
Answer_1: prevent chipping of the ceramic coating
Answer_2: prevent condensation in the steam baffling
Answer_3: avoid excessive cooling and condensation of the exhaust gases
Answer_4: maintain a positive seal on the replaceable basket

Question_Title: If the fires in both boilers start to sputter, you should immediately __________.
Answer_1: shift feed suction to the double bottom
Answer_2: speed up the fuel oil pump

Question_Title: Rotating flyweights acting against a spring force makes up a simple type of __________.
Air for combustion is bypassed around the boiler air heater when the __________.
Answer_3: combustion control system is in manual
Answer_4: boiler is steaming at low rates

Question_Title: If the fires start sputtering while steaming under steady conditions, which of the actions listed should be taken?
Answer_1: Start the standby fuel oil service pump.
Answer_3: Shift over to another fuel strainer.
Answer_4: Shift suction to another settling tank.

Question_Title: The main throttle valve on a turbine admits steam directly  into the __________.
When a vessel is in port, stack type air heaters are bypassed in order to prevent __________.
Answer_1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Answer_2: corrosion of the heater due to low stack temperatures
Answer_3: excessive back pressure in the furnace due to low flow rates
Answer_4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question_Title: Oil in the contaminated drain inspection tank results from  __________.
Answer_1: a defective relief valve on the fuel oil heater
Answer_2: improper drainage of the fuel oil heater coils
Answer_3: a leaking heating coil in a fuel oil settling tank
Answer_4: operating the fuel oil heater at excessive temperatures

Question_Title: If a turbine bearing high temperature alarm sounds, you should immediately __________.
Accumulation tests are conducted in order to determine the  __________.
Answer_1: steam generating capacity of an individual boiler
Answer_2: steam relieving capacity of safety valves
Answer_3: maximum combined oil consumption of all oil burners installed on a single boiler
Answer_4: maximum combined steam generating capacity for all  propulsion boilers of a single plant

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions would indicate a dirty atomizer sprayer plate?
Answer_2: Carbon deposits on the register doors.
Answer_3: Dark streaks in the burner flame.

Question_Title: In a steam turbine and reduction gear main propulsion plant, the sending unit for the low oil pressure signal is usually installed __________.
Answer_1: at a point on the inlet side of the main bearings as close  to the bearings as possible
Answer_2: at a point on the outlet side of the main bearings as close to the bearings as possible
Answer_3: at the point of highest pressure in the supply line to the  bearings
Answer_4: at the point of lowest pressure in the supply line to the bearings

Question_Title: Where three gear trains, i.e. high pressure first reduction, low pressure first reduction, and second reduction are each contained in a separate and sequential portion of the gear  housing, the reduction gear unit is known as __________.
Before blowing tubes in a boiler equipped with steam soot blowers, you should __________.
Answer_3: reduce the forced draft fan speed

Question_Title: If the fuel oil service piping was leaking upstream of the  quick-closing valve, you should be able to stop the leak by closing the __________.
An overheated bearing in the main propulsion unit is indicated by __________.
Answer_1: bubbles in the sight flow glasses
Answer_2: sludge in the lube oil strainers
Answer_3: high level in the lube oil sump
Answer_4: high temperature of the lube oil leaving the bearing

Question_Title: Rotating flyweights, acting against a spring force, will provide a simple type of __________.
Before using the steam soot blowers to blow tubes at sea, you should __________.
Which of the conditions listed can cause the flame of a mechanically atomized burner to be blown away from the burner tip when you are attempting to light off?
Answer_1: Insufficient excess air is being supplied to the furnace.
Answer_2: Fuel oil viscosity is too low.
Answer_4: The secondary air cone is improperly adjusted.

Question_Title: Hot running bearings can be caused by __________.
A constant speed hydraulic governor would more than likely  be installed on a __________.
In preparing to blow tubes at sea, you should __________.
Poor atomization accompanied by an elongated flame from a steam atomization burner is MOST likely caused by __________.
Answer_1: the fuel oil temperature being too low
Answer_2: improper operation of traps in atomizing steam return piping
Answer_3: the forced draft fan too slow for the boiler load

Question_Title: An excess pressure governor should be used on a __________.
Boiler forced draft pressure should be increased before blowing tubes to __________.
Answer_4: prevent a drop in steam pressure

Question_Title: Fluctuations in the atomizing steam pressure at the burners could be caused by a/an __________.
Answer_1: malfunctioning steam trap in the atomizing steam system

Question_Title: The constant pressure governor of a turbine-driven feed pump maintains which of the following pressures at a constant value for all capacities?
After routine blowing of tubes at sea, there should be a decrease in the __________.
Answer_3: excess air required for complete combustion

Question_Title: A triple element, main propulsion, boiler feedwater regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Answer_4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question_Title: When slight sputtering is detected at the boiler atomizer,  you should __________.
Answer_1: check for water in the fuel supply
Answer_3: shut off the oil supply and purge the furnace
Answer_4: close burner register shutters and increase fuel oil service pump speed

Question_Title: Guardian valves are installed on main propulsion turbines to __________.
Answer_1: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element while the vessel is maneuvering
Answer_2: provide an emergency means of quickly closing the throttle
Answer_3: provide a means to supply steam directly to the astern element of the turbine
Answer_4: prevent steam from leaking into the astern element while at full sea speed

Question_Title: Which of the listed operational precautions is necessary before blowing tubes?
Answer_2: Open all drains in soot blower steam supply piping.
Answer_3: Thoroughly warm all soot blower steam supply piping.

Question_Title: A pneumatic dual element, main propulsion, boiler feedwater regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.
In any governor there is a small range of speed in which no corrective action occurs.  This speed range is called the governor dead band and is caused by __________.
Answer_1: friction in the governor linkage and control valve
Answer_2: excessive sensitivity in the governor control valve
Answer_3: speed droop designed into the governor system
Answer_4: hydraulic slippage in the governor servomotor system

Question_Title: Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blower elements to __________.
Answer_1: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating  through blowing arcs
Answer_2: prevent buildup of soot on the element
Answer_4: prevent the backup of combustion gases into soot blower heads

Question_Title: A single element boiler feedwater regulating system used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Answer_4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question_Title: Lube oil coolers are necessary in most engine lubricating systems because __________.
Answer_1: engine oil is used continuously and cooling prevents the oil from wearing out
Answer_2: harmful acids will be condensed and then removed by the centrifuge
Answer_3: cooling increases viscosity and aids in maintaining the oil film strength
Answer_4: cooling decreases viscosity and improves engine thermal efficiency

Question_Title: The arc through which a steam soot blower element blows is  regulated by the __________.
In a multi-burner firebox, a burner tip with a scratched or enlarged orifice will __________.
Answer_1: have no effect on the flow of oil if the proper pressure is maintained
Answer_2: result in an uneven flow of oil through the burner
Answer_3: cause a high fuel oil return line back pressure

Question_Title: Which of the following types of bearings are used for the reduction gears in a marine steam turbine installation?
The primary purpose of the boiler internal dry pipe is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent priming and foaming in the boiler drum
Answer_2: remove all moisture from steam leaving the boiler
Answer_3: permit a flow of nearly dry saturated steam
Answer_4: prevent foreign materials from entering the steam drum

Question_Title: Excessive accumulation of carbon deposits on a boiler burner throat ring and diffuser could result in __________.
Answer_2: a reduced boiler fuel oil pressure

Question_Title: To accurately measure the amount of wear on a high speed pinion journal bearing with a bridge gage, you must __________.
Answer_1: be sure that the area of greatest wear is at 90 to the measuring pin
Answer_2: shift the journal to position the pinion off center in the  bearing
Answer_3: raise the journal to a height equal to the oil clearance
Answer_4: roll the bearing shell until the wearing zone is at the bottom

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents one operational characteristic of a cyclone steam separator?
Answer_1: Unit reduces the circulation of the steam and water mixture in the boiler.
Answer_2: Unit imparts a rotational motion to the steam and water mixture.
Answer_3: Steam is forced to the outer side of the separator by centrifugal force.
Answer_4: Water is forced upward by centrifugal force.

Question_Title: Carbon deposits on the boiler burner throat ring is usually caused by __________.
Answer_4: the burner cycling on and off

Question_Title: As steam first enters the main propulsion turbine, which of the following energy conversions takes place?
Circulation of boiler water to the water wall tubes is maintained by the __________.
Failure of the fuel oil service pump to maintain fuel oil flow to the burner could be caused by __________.
Precautions to be observed prior to starting a turbine driven cargo pump, should include __________.
Answer_1: assuring that the turbine casing drains are wired closed
Answer_2: observing the operation of the overspeed trip
Answer_3: open all governor oil relay drains
Answer_4: checking the hand tripping device for proper operation

Question_Title: When preparing to cut a boiler in on the line, you determine that the steam pressure of the incoming boiler is about 5 psig above line pressure.  Which of the following steps should you take next?
Failure of the fuel oil service pump to maintain fuel oil flow to the burners of the boiler could result from __________.
Answer_2: carbon deposits on the ignition electrode
Answer_3: leaks in the pump suction line

Question_Title: Which of the listed tubes provides circulation to the water wall tubes?
If oil is found in the fuel oil heating drain system when using live steam directly to the heating coils, which of the actions listed should be taken?
Answer_2: Shift contaminated drains to proper holding area.
Answer_4: Shift to low fuel oil suction.

Question_Title: Fuel oil may be discovered in the contaminated drain inspection tank when the __________.
Answer_4: steam operated fuel oil pump leaks

Question_Title: A back pressure trip on an auxiliary turbo-generator functions to secure the device if the __________.
Answer_2: discharge pressure of a turbine driven pump is excessive
Answer_3: gland seal leakoff pressure is too high
Answer_4: exhaust pressure rises above a preset limit

Question_Title: The function of downcomers installed in water-tube boilers  is to __________.
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_4: decrease the rate of steam generation

Question_Title: A leak in the heating coils of a fuel oil heater will first show up as __________.
Answer_1: water in the fuel oil supply
Answer_2: oil in the drain inspection tank

Question_Title: When a main propulsion turbine throttle malfunction develops, affecting both the main and secondary control stations, you should __________.
Answer_1: override the automated circuit and manually control the engine
Answer_2: override the automated circuit and shut down the engine
Answer_3: allow the automatic shutdown circuit to shut down the engine, then locate the problem
Answer_4: immediately make an entry in the engine log

Question_Title: Downcomers installed in water-tube boilers function to __________.
Answer_1: distribute feedwater within the water drum
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_3: accelerate the generation of superheated steam
Answer_4: accelerate water circulation in the boiler

Question_Title: A suspected leak in an operating fuel oil heating coil is normally confirmed by __________.
Answer_1: checking the pH of heating coil returns

Question_Title: In steam turbine and reduction gear units, lube oil coolers installed in the lube oil system are located between the __________.
Answer_1: lube oil pumps and gravity tanks
Answer_3: gravity tanks and lube oil sump
Answer_4: lube oil sump and lube oil pumps

Question_Title: Downcomers installed in water-tube boilers function to __________.
Answer_1: distribute feedwater within the water drum
Answer_2: decrease the end point for moisture carryover
Answer_3: cool the tubes adjacent to the burner throats
Answer_4: ensure proper circulation to the water wall headers

Question_Title: A leak in a heating coil in a fuel oil storage tank should  be detected quickly by __________.
Answer_1: an increase in fuel oil temperature
Answer_2: observing oil on the contaminated evaporator steam coils
Answer_3: the presence of fuel oil in the inspection tank
Answer_4: the sputtering of burners in the boilers

Question_Title: In a segmental pivoted-shoe thrust bearing, the thrust load among the shoes is equalized by the __________.
Downcomers are used in modern boilers to __________.
Answer_1: circulate water to the mud drum

Question_Title: Accumulation of fuel oil in the boiler double casing could  be caused by __________.
Downcomers are frequently mounted outside the boiler casing on a water-tube boiler for the purpose of __________.
Answer_1: reducing heat in the downcomers and improving water circulation
Answer_2: improving the cooling of the lower tube banks
Answer_3: causing suspended solids in the boiler water to settle in the water drums
Answer_4: providing for easy maintenance and repair

Question_Title: Fuel oil accumulation in a boiler double front is caused by __________.
Because of the pressure drop existing across each diaphragm, the flow of steam between the nozzle diaphragm and the rotor of the turbine is held to a minimum by __________.
The boiler economizer provides additional heat to the __________.
Carbon deposits on the diffuser and register throat ring of a burner __________.
Answer_1: interfere with air flow around the burner
Answer_2: cause pre-ignition of the atomized fuel
Answer_3: allow heat loss to the boiler casing
Answer_4: are of no consequence and may be left in place until a fireside inspection allows time for removal

Question_Title: Most auxiliary turbines do not require an external source of gland sealing steam because they __________.
Answer_2: exhaust to pressures above atmospheric pressure
Answer_3: utilize carbon packing rings at the low pressure end
Answer_4: operate with only a small amount of axial thrust

Question_Title: A check valve is located between the economizer and the steam drum to __________.
Answer_1: assure a positive feedwater flow through the economizer
Answer_2: assure a positive feedwater flow to the steam drum
Answer_3: prevent the feed pump from becoming vapor bound
Answer_4: prevent steam and water drum losses should an economizer casualty occur

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed could be responsible for the flame of a mechanical atomizer to blow out when attempting  to light off?
Answer_1: The openings in the diffuser are improperly adjusted.
Answer_2: The radial air doors are closed.
Answer_3: The distance piece is improperly adjusted.
Answer_4: The viscosity of the fuel oil is too low.

Question_Title: The minimum feedwater inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Answer_1: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Answer_3: temperature of steam bled off the HP turbine

Question_Title: When preparing water-tube boilers for hydrostatic testing,  they shall be filled with water at not __________.
Heating the fuel oil to an excessively high a temperature in a fuel oil heater will cause __________.
Answer_1: a loss of fuel oil suction

Question_Title: Large temperature and pressure drops in the first stage of a combination impulse and reaction turbine are caused by __________.
Answer_2: steam passing through a single row of blades more than once
Answer_3: using a dummy piston and cylinder to offset axial thrust
Answer_4: a velocity-compounded impulse stage at the high pressure end of the turbine

Question_Title: The minimum feedwater inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Answer_2: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Answer_3: surface area of the third stage heater
Answer_4: radiant heat transfer in the furnace

Question_Title: A sequential lift, nozzle valve control bar utilizes which  of the following operating principles?
Answer_1: A lifting beam mechanism engages valve stems of varying lengths.
Answer_2: A hydraulic piston raises or lowers groups of valves according to pressure received from a governor.
Answer_3: A hydraulic piston raises or lowers individual valves according to pressure received from a governor.
Answer_4: A servomotor, mechanically connected to nozzle valve handwheels, opens or closes the valves in accordance with the type of electrical signal received.

Question_Title: What part of the turbine assembly is used to relieve strain on the turbine caused by thermal stress?

Answer_1: it is necessary to fire more fuel to maintain the required  evaporative rating
Answer_2: there is always the danger of metal oxidation in the economizer
Answer_3: less heat is actually being transferred to the steam because of the decrease in the ratio of gas to steam weight

Question_Title: According to U. S. Coast Regulations (46 CFR), water-tube boilers shall be hydrostatically tested on passenger vessels every __________.

Answer_1: Start the standby fuel service pump.
Answer_2: Increase the fuel service pump speed.
Answer_3: Increase the furnace air supply pressure.
Answer_4: Shift to the settler high suction.

Question_Title: Contaminated steam generators are usually __________.

Answer_1: keep the forced draft discharge dampers open wide
Answer_2: permit full maneuvering capability without the necessity of changing blower speed
Answer_4: ensure that all burners will remain ignited at low load

Question_Title: In the operation of a lube oil clarifier, the position of the oil-water interface should be __________.
Answer_2: maintained by the number of disks in the disk stack
Answer_4: maintained by the diaphragm-type, weir control valve

Question_Title: The purpose of a contaminated steam system is to __________.
Answer_2: ensure fouled heating coil returns from fuel tanks do not contaminate boiler feedwater
Answer_3: distill makeup feed for use as potable water
Answer_4: ensure an uncontaminated source of feed for the makeup evaporator

Question_Title: The component of a Kingsbury thrust bearing which transmits the thrust from the shaft to the oil film and shoes is the  __________.
The purpose of the prerotation vane damper installed in a boiler forced draft blower is to __________.
Answer_1: control the air volume to a steaming boiler
Answer_2: prevent air from entering an idle boiler furnace
Answer_3: provide a natural draft when the blower is secured
Answer_4: equalize the forced draft air between steaming boilers

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the inspection of water-tube boilers?
Answer_1: All mountings shall be opened up and examined by a Coast Guard inspector at eight year intervals after the initial inspection.
Answer_2: All boiler mounting studs or bolts shall be removed for examination by a Coast Guard inspector every 4 years after  initial inspection.
Answer_3: Boiler mountings attached to boiler nozzles must be opened  and removed for examination every 8 years.
Answer_4: Boiler mountings attached directly to the boiler plating by screwed studs and nuts shall be removed and examined every 8 years.

Question_Title: A contaminated steam generator is used to produce saturated vapor from collected __________.
Failure to use the turning gear prior to warming up a main  turbine will damage the __________.
What is the advantage of a forced water circulation boiler over a natural circulation boiler?
Answer_1: The circulating pump need not operate when low pressure steam is required.
Answer_2: Boiler tubes are less likely to overheat.
Answer_3: A steam accumulator is not required.

Question_Title: Why is a flexible I-beam rigidly mounted at the forward end of the main turbine?
Answer_1: To relieve stress on the hull.
Answer_2: Allow for turbine casing expansion and contraction.
Answer_3: To relieve stress at the light end of the turbine.
Answer_4: Prevent the reaction developed within the turbine from being transmitted to the hull.

Question_Title: If a feed pump failure causes the boiler water to drop out  of sight in the gage glass, the engineer should FIRST __________.
Answer_1: secure the fires, steam stops and then add water
Answer_2: secure the fires, reduce steam load and start standby feed  pump
Answer_3: reduce the steaming rate and then cool the boiler with the  force draft fan
Answer_4: reduce the steaming rate and then add water

Question_Title: Steam piping subject to main boiler pressure must be hydrostatically tested at specified intervals.  Therefore,  which of the following statements is true?
Answer_1: The piping must be tested at a pressure and temperature specified by a Coast Guard marine inspector.
Answer_2: The piping must be tested at 1 1/2 times working pressure every 4 years.
Answer_3: Piping under 3 inches nominal pipe size need not be hydrostatically tested.
Answer_4: The piping must be tested at 1 1/2 times maximum allowable  pressure every 4 years.

Question_Title: When starting a turbogenerator, you must provide lube oil pressure to the unit by means of __________.
Answer_1: a line from the other generator
Answer_2: a line from the gravity tank
Answer_4: the hand operated or auxiliary lube oil pump

Question_Title: Lower than normal steam pressure in an operating boiler may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: a sudden drop in superheater outlet temperature
Answer_3: a low water level in the steam drum

Question_Title: Which action should be taken if the water level in the gage glass drops out of sight and the burner fails to secure automatically?
A hydraulic governing system for a turbogenerator unit maintains constant turbine speed by using a governor flyweight-actuated pilot valve to control oil flow and to directly __________.
Answer_1: change the position of the turbine throttle valve
Answer_2: change the position of the governor lever
Answer_3: vary steam pressure in the steam chest

Question_Title: The water level in one boiler of a two boiler plant rapidly falls out of sight, which of the following actions should be carried out FIRST?
Answer_1: Secure the fuel oil to the low water boiler.
Answer_4: Have the engineer on watch wait for help

Question_Title: The rotating speed of the tubular bowl centrifuge is more than twice that of the disk type.  The reason for this is __________.
Answer_1: a narrow diameter bowl is not effected as much by windage losses as a larger diameter bowl
Answer_2: the friction affecting rotation is not as significant with a narrow diameter bowl
Answer_3: the drag bushing is used to permit the higher speed of rotation
Answer_4: to produce a nearly equal magnitude of centrifugal force

Question_Title: The reversing turbine is normally used for which of the following operations?
Which of the following statements is true concerning boiler inspections?
Answer_1: The marine inspector may require any boiler to be drilled to determine its actual thickness any time its safety is in doubt.
Answer_2: At the first inspection for certification after a water-tube boiler has been installed for ten years, it shall be gaged  by drilling to determine the actual extent of deterioration.
Answer_3: If the thickness found as a result of gaging is less than original thickness, the boiler must be condemned.
Answer_4: Any user of a nondestructive testing device must demonstrate that results with an accuracy of plus or minus one percent  are consistently obtainable.

Question_Title: When a lube oil purifier has been cleaned, but a small amount of sludge remains in one spot of the bowl side, the  __________.
Answer_1: seal will be gradually lost after being placed into operation
Answer_3: temperature of the oil input will have to be lowered
Answer_4: dirty oil pump discharge pressure will need to be increased

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is used to compensate for the expansion and minor misalignments occurring between the main turbines and the reduction gears?
The disk stack and tubular shaft used in a lube oil centrifugal purifier, is forced to rotate at bowl speed by  __________.
Answer_1: the use of an acme thread screw

Question_Title: Reduction gears for main propulsion turbines are lubricated by __________.
Answer_1: grease cups and gravity feed lines
Answer_2: oil flinger rings mounted on the shaft
Answer_3: leak off lines from the lube oil cooler
Answer_4: spray nozzles at the gear meshing points

Question_Title: Which of the listed parts of a Kingsbury thrust bearing tilts to permit the formation of a wedge shaped film of oil?
If the bowl of a centrifugal purifier is improperly reassembled with O-ring seals that have become hard and flat, the centrifuge __________.
Answer_2: will begin to lose its water seal
Answer_3: will discharge oil to the main sump as dirty as the input
Answer_4: bowl will rotate at a lower speed

Question_Title: Why are convergent-divergent nozzles used in high-pressure  turbine applications?
Answer_2: They are less susceptible to steam erosion than other nozzle types due to their shape.
Answer_3: They produce a larger pressure drop and therefore are more  efficient than other nozzle types.
Answer_4: They direct the steam flow more efficiently than other nozzle types.

Question_Title: When water is removed from lube oil passing through a centrifugal purifier, the water removed will __________.
Answer_2: force the diameter of the oil column within the bowl to be narrowed
Answer_3: displace water from the heavy phase discharge port, but of an amount less than that removed from the oil
Answer_4: displace an equal amount of water from the bowl seal

Question_Title: Which of the parts listed for a reaction turbine serve the  same function as the nozzles of an impulse turbine?
Which of the following statements would best describe the purpose of rotating the hand operated lube oil pump on an auxiliary turbo-generating unit?
Answer_1: It supplements the main lube oil pump flow while paralleling the generators.
Answer_2: It empties the governor control reserve prior to shutting down.
Answer_3: It assists in opening the governor control valve while starting the unit.
Answer_4: It permits the changeover of lube oil filters.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the centrifuging of lubricating oil?
Answer_1: Centrifuging is more effective with inhibited oils than straight mineral oils.
Answer_2: Centrifuging is more efficient when the oil is preheated prior to centrifuging.
Answer_3: Silicones are water soluble and easily removed by centrifuging.
Answer_4: Centrifuging will purge the oil of various contaminants, including acids and alkalis.

Question_Title: In addition to the direction of steam flow, which of the descriptions listed may also be used to classify turbines?
Answer_1: The method in which the steam causes the turbine rotor to rotate.
Answer_2: The type of staging and compounding of steam pressures and  velocities.
Answer_3: The division of the steam flow.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes how the main propulsion turbine overspeed relay initiates closing of the throttle valve?
Answer_1: Excessive centrifugal force causes a spring loaded weight to trip a valve latch.
Answer_2: Excessive centrifugal force causes spring loaded flyballs to actuate a control lever.
Answer_3: Excessive speed causes an oil pump to develop sufficient  pressure to activate a spring loaded relay valve which tends to close the steam control valve.
Answer_4: Excessive speed causes an increase in lube oil control temperature which actuates a solenoid oil dump valve.

Question_Title: If the engineer on watch has reason to doubt the accuracy of the water level shown in the boiler gage glass, he should __________.
Answer_1: speed up the main feed pump

Question_Title: In the operation of a main propulsion turbine, using bar-lift throttle valve control, the successive opening of  the valves __________.
Answer_1: admits more steam to the steam chest
Answer_2: increases the steam flow to the HP turbine first stage
Answer_3: increases the pressure of steam in the steam chest
Answer_4: bypasses the flow of steam directly to the later turbine stages

Question_Title: In a disk type centrifugal purifier, the contaminated oil enters the bowl __________.
Answer_1: at the bottom through the oil inlet
Answer_2: at the top through the regulating tube
Answer_3: through the neck of the top disk

Question_Title: Which of the descriptions listed applies to a Rateau stage?
Answer_1: One set of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Answer_2: One set of nozzles and one row of moving blades.
Answer_3: Two sets of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Answer_4: Two sets of nozzles and one row of moving blades.

Question_Title: One boiler of a two boiler plant has ruptured a tube and the water cannot be maintained in sight in the gage glass. After securing the fires, your next action should be to __________.
Answer_2: stop the fuel oil service pump
Answer_3: secure the feedwater supply to the boiler

Question_Title: 46 CFR Parts 59 and 35 require that __________.
Answer_1: the OCMI be notified of repairs to  boilers and unfired pressure vessels
Answer_2: the fuel burned in boilers of tankships shall have a flash  point of not less than 130F
Answer_3: a one pint sample of each load of fuel be drawn and sealed at the time of supply and preserved until that fuel is exhausted

Question_Title: Which of the following methods is used to lubricate main propulsion turbine reduction gears?
Answer_1: The gears run through an open oil sump and oil is carried along on the gear teeth.
Answer_2: Oil is sprayed through nozzles at the point of gear mesh.
Answer_3: Oil is pressure fed through internal drilled passages which force oil to the gear's periphery.
Answer_4: Oil rings in channels outside the gears dip into oil in the sump and carry it to the gear teeth.

Question_Title: If a tube failure results from low water level and you cannot maintain water in sight in the gage glass, you should __________.
Answer_1: immediately secure the forced draft fans
Answer_2: increase the feed pump speed to maximum
Answer_3: immediately secure the fuel oil supply to the burners
Answer_4: blowdown the gage glass to verify a low water condition

Question_Title: Should one boiler on a two boiler vessel suffer serious tube damage, the Officer-in-Charge, Marine Inspection may issue a permit (Form CG-948) to proceed to another port for repair __________.
Answer_1: only if the vessel's Certificate of Inspection is valid and has not expired
Answer_2: as long as no cargo or passengers are being carried
Answer_3: only upon written application of the master, owner, or agent of the vessel

Question_Title: Which of the following enables a Kingsbury, or any  pivot shoe type thrust bearing, to bear a much greater load per square inch of working surface than parallel surface bearings?
Answer_1: The thickness of the filler piece behind the pivotal-shoes  is adjusted to obtain a more accurate fit.
Answer_2: Clearances are automatically adjusted to the correct value  when wear occurs.
Answer_3: The shoes tilt slightly thereby allowing the formation of a wedge shaped oil film under a thrust load.
Answer_4: The shoes pivot, thus remaining parallel with the collar when thrust loads are applied.

Question_Title: Which of the following actions should be carried out if the boiler water level is falling due to a tube failure?
Answer_1: Secure the fires and try to maintain the water level.
Answer_2: Speed up the feed pump to keep the water level up while firing the boiler.
Answer_3: Open the auxiliary feed stop and check for extra feed.
Answer_4: Start the standby feed pump and feed the boiler using two feedpumps.

Question_Title: The maximum temperature rise of oil passing through any reduction gear set, or bearing, should not exceed __________.
During a maintenance inspection of a turbogenerator, the integral turbine wheels are tapped with a hammer.  What condition may be indicated by a dead sound?
Which of the following designs is an essential feature of the Rateau type turbine?
Answer_1: A large pressure and temperature drop occurring in the first stage.
Answer_2: The use of alternate rows of fixed and moving blades.
Answer_3: The use of a velocity-compounded impulse stage installed at the high pressure end of the turbine.
Answer_4: Two or more simple impulse stages aligned in tandem in one  casing.

Question_Title: The fireman/watertender secures the fires because there is  no visible water level in the gage glasses of a steaming boiler.  Upon inspection, you observe condensate trickling  down the inside of the gage glass.  This indicates  __________.
Answer_4: steam binding of the feedwater regulating valve sensing line from the top of the steam drum

Question_Title: A turbogenerator back pressure trip can be actuated as a result of __________.
Answer_1: insufficient circulating water flow through the condenser
Answer_2: a steam inlet valve being partially open
Answer_3: an excessive pressure drop through the turbine

Question_Title: A pilot valve and servomotor are utilized in mechanical-hydraulic governing systems in order to __________.
Answer_1: provide sufficient force to operate large steam control valves
Answer_2: provide a means of operational hunting
Answer_3: attain 100% of regulation with zero speed droop
Answer_4: All of the above are incorrect.

Question_Title: After the main engine has reached full sea speed, which of  the following conditions could cause the water level in the boiler steam drum to keep falling?
Answer_1: Open cutout valves on the boiler gage glasses.
Answer_2: Condensate recirculating line is excessively open.
Answer_3: Feed pump discharge pressure is set too low.
Answer_4: Feed pump recirculating valve is closed.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the significance of the differential pressure existing between  the nozzle block and steam chest of a turbogenerator equipped with a lifting beam mechanism?
Answer_1: The pressure differential necessitates the use of special spherical valve seating surfaces.
Answer_2: The pressure differential eliminates the possibility of valve binding in the lifting beam.
Answer_3: The pressure differential requires the installation of a special biasing spring to open the valves.
Answer_4: The pressure differential assists in seating the valves when the lifting beam is lowered.

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is used to convert thermal energy into kinetic energy in the reaction turbine?

Fine metallic particles, which may originate from wear or failure of the lube oil service pump internal parts, are prevented from contaminating the bearings served by the lube oil system by __________.
Answer_1: the settling action of solid matter in the gravity tank
Answer_2: use of the magnetic strainers in the lube oil service pump  discharge piping
Answer_3: the change of direction and settling action within the lube oil coolers
Answer_4: batch centrifuging the lube oil at least once a week

Question_Title: In a double reduction gear, the function of a quill shaft is to provide flexibility between the second reduction pinion  and the __________.
One of the most effective methods of improving purification in tubular and disk type centrifugal purifiers is to __________.
Answer_1: decrease the viscosity of the oil by heating
Answer_2: increase the pressure at which the oil is fed through the purifier
Answer_3: match the discharge ring size outside diameter with the lube oil's specific gravity
Answer_4: use the smallest inside diameter of the discharge ring size without a loss of oil with the discharge water

Question_Title: The internal feed pipe of a power boiler distributes the feed water into the __________.
While making engine room rounds at sea, you observe excessive steam leaking from the forward gland on the high  pressure turbine.  This may indicate that the __________.
Answer_1: turbine is operating at low speed
Answer_2: gland seal leakoff line is obstructed
Answer_3: main condenser vacuum is too high

Question_Title: Which of the following is used to hold the poppet valves closed in the turbine nozzle control valves?

Answer_3: uncontrolled escape of combustion gases up the stack

Question_Title: The three-wing device used in the tubular bowl purifier, is held in place and forced to rotate at bowl speed by the __________.
Answer_1: vertical shallow grooves machined into the bowl surface
Answer_2: flexible wire springs secured to the edge of each 'wing'
Answer_3: locating pin pressed into the top edge of the three-wing device
Answer_4: drive pin pressed into the interior surface of the bowl

Question_Title: The overspeed tripping device installed on an auxiliary turbine is automatically actuated by __________.

Answer_1: presence of oil is indicated in the gravity tank bull's-eye
Answer_4: trapped water is discharged from the overflow line

Question_Title: If one fuel strainer of a duplex strainer unit becomes clogged while your vessel is underway, you should first __________.
Answer_2: change the oil flow over to the clean side

Question_Title: The valve opening sequence for bar-lift nozzle control valves in a marine steam turbine is determined by __________.
Answer_2: pilot valves which initiate movement of each individual valve bar
Answer_3: the distance between the top of the bar and the adjusting nuts on the valve stems
Answer_4: electro-hydraulic servomotors attached to individual valve  stems

Question_Title: The proper way to quickly reduce high water level in a steaming boiler is to use the __________.
Axial thrust developed in a reaction turbine is the result  of a steam pressure drop in __________.
Answer_4: both the moving and stationary blades

Question_Title: What type of strainer is used in a turbine lube oil system  to remove metallic particles?

Answer_1: allow for gross radial misalignment of the high-speed pinion
Answer_2: reduce backlash in the reduction gear
Answer_3: allow for flexibility between the high-speed pinion and first reduction gear
Answer_4: allow for axial flexibility between the first reduction gear and second reduction pinion

Question_Title: Why do double flow reaction turbines produce very little axial thrust?
Answer_1: Because there is never any axial thrust developed.
Answer_2: Because partially expanded steam is exhausted to another low pressure turbine where the expansion is completed.
Answer_3: Because the axial thrust is developed at each end in opposite directions to counterbalance each other.
Answer_4: Because equalizing holes are provided in the turbine wheels.

Question_Title: The labyrinth seals used on rotating steam turbine shafts reduces external leakage by causing __________.
Answer_1: successive pressure drops through the seal stages
Answer_2: successive temperature drops through the seal stages
Answer_3: pressure increases through successive seal stages
Answer_4: increased turbulence through successively larger labyrinth  clearances

Question_Title: Why are geared turbine installations equipped with turning  mechanisms?
Answer_1: For jacking the main engine over periodically when secured.
Answer_2: For turning the main engine during routine inspections.
Answer_3: For turning the main engine during warm-up and securing operations.
Answer_4: For all of the above purposes.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning the main steam stop valves on multiple boiler installations incorporating uncontrolled superheaters?
Answer_1: When only one valve is used, it must be of the stop-check type.
Answer_2: The resistance to closing increases as the cross-sectional  area of the valve seat opening decreases.
Answer_3: A six inch main steam stop must be fitted with a bypass for heating of the line and equalizing the pressure before the  valve is opened.

Question_Title: To prevent damage to the turning gear mechanism, which of the following procedures must be carried out before the turning gear is engaged?
Answer_1: The brake on the first reduction worm shaft must be set.
Answer_2: The propeller shaft must be stopped and held stationary until the clutch is engaged.
Answer_3: The engine order telegraph must be on 'stop'.
Answer_4: The speed of the astern turbine must be reduced.

Question_Title: If two turbo-generators with the same no-load speed settings are operating in parallel, the unit whose governor has the  lesser speed droop will __________.
Answer_1: assume the smaller share of the load
Answer_2: assume the larger share of the load

Question_Title: Water circulates within a natural circulation boiler as a result of the __________.
Answer_1: difference in the tube length and diameter
Answer_3: differences in density within the circulating medium
Answer_4: difference between the heights of the boiler drums

Question_Title: The turning gear mechanism of a geared turbine installation is designed to turn the main engine at a rate of speed that is __________.
Answer_1: approximately equal to their normal operating speeds
Answer_2: approximately equal to their maximum operating speeds
Answer_3: very slow in relation to their normal operating speeds
Answer_4: very fast in relation to their normal operating speeds

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed is used to engage the main engine turning gear to the high pressure turbine high-speed pinion?
Main steam turbine lubricating oil systems are fitted with  __________.

Answer_1: difference in tube length and diameter
Answer_3: difference in density between the water and the steam/water mixture
Answer_4: difference between the heights of the boiler drums

Question_Title: Flexible couplings used in modern turbine reduction gear installations would include __________.

Answer_2: fluid friction in the downcomers, drums, generating tubes,  and headers
Answer_3: too low of a feedwater temperature
Answer_4: back pressure in the steam drum acting on the user tubes

Question_Title: In which type of turbine listed does the same turbine wheel use the steam flow more than once?

Answer_1: Secure the main steam line drains.
Answer_4: Purge the furnace of combustible gases.

Question_Title: Inefficient operation or a faulty condition of turbine components will be indicated by an abnormal variation of which condition?
Answer_4: All of the above conditions are individually correct.

Question_Title: The safety device provided on turbogenerators to close the  throttle automatically when exhaust pressure reach a preset maximum is called a/an __________.

Answer_4: second reduction and the shaft thrust bearing

Question_Title: The primary purpose of screen tubes installed in a marine boiler is to __________.
Answer_2: protect the furnace casing and retain furnace heat

Answer_4: protect the superheater from radiation heat transfer

Question_Title: Which of the following problems can occur when an excessive number of water screen tubes are plugged?
Answer_3: Steam pressure leaving the drum will increase.
Answer_4: Steam temperature in the drum will decrease.

Question_Title: The adjustable spherically seated self-aligning bearing housings used in main turbines are provided with oil deflector rings.  The function of these rings is to __________.
Answer_1: ensure efficient lubrication of the bearing
Answer_2: prevent the leakage of main steam into the oil

Answer_4: direct the flow of oil through the bearing

Question_Title: Which of the listed components is used to protect the boiler superheater against the radiant heat of the furnace?

Answer_1: They are of the single casting type bearing.

Question_Title: Using a dry uncoated sounding rod or tape to measure the depth of water in a reserve feed water tank will __________.
Answer_4: be satisfactory if a small amount of oil is floating on the surface

Question_Title: Which of the following types of bearings are used as line shaft bearings?
Which of the devices listed are used to rigidly mount reduction gear bearings in their housings?
The most likely effect of water slugging in the steam supply to a ship service turbogenerator is __________.
Which of the conditions listed occurs when glassy slag, formed by the burning of fuel oil contaminated with salt water, melts and runs over the furnace wall?
The splits located in the halves of main reduction gear bearings are aligned at an angle to the horizontal in order to resist __________.
To properly sound a reserve feed water tank, you should use a/an__________.
Answer_3: manila line with an attached weight

Question_Title: Which possible condition has occurred if a vacuum is present at the atmospheric drain tank vent while the vessel is underway?
Answer_1: The control valve regulating flow to the main condenser is stuck in an open position.
Answer_2: The control valve ball float has been holed causing the ball to remain in a lowered position.
Answer_3: There is a definite possibility of the tank overflowing causing loss of distilled water.
Answer_4: There will be an increase of vacuum in the main condensor within a short period of time.

Question_Title: The transfer of the heat produced by friction in the bearings to the lube oil is assisted through the use of __________.
The level of the drain inspection tank continually decreases after steam is admitted to a double bottom tank fuel oil heating coil.  You can expect __________.
Which of the following statements describes the function of a ship's propulsion plant main reduction gear thrust bearing?
Answer_1: Support the weight of the reduction gears.
Answer_2: Absorb the transmitted power when radial thrust is  developed.
Answer_3: Absorb the axial thrust transmitted through the shaft from  the propeller.
Answer_4: To absorb only the thrust developed by the high pressure turbine.

Question_Title: Turbine lube oil suction strainer baskets have __________.
Which of the following operational practices is helpful in  avoiding the accumulation of condensate in the main reduction gear casing?
Answer_1: Always ensure that the lubricating oil pressure is 14-17 psi when operating in unusually cold waters.
Answer_2: The temperature of the lubricating oil should not exceed the gear manufacturer's recommendation when the unit is operating at full load.
Answer_3: After the main unit is secured, lubricating oil should be circulated until the temperature of the oil and reduction gear casing approximates the engine room temperature.
Answer_4: Avoid applying gland sealing steam to the low pressure turbine until you are ready to start up the first-stage air ejector.

Question_Title: Which of the bearings listed is used in some turbines to limit axial movement?
The Kingsbury bearing is equipped with pivoted shoes in order to __________.
Which of the features listed, regarding the Kingsbury thrust bearing, prevents the base ring from turning and secures it to its housing?
Answer_3: A combination of pin and dowel

Question_Title: In a reduction gear train, a quill shaft of high torsional  flexibility provides __________.
Answer_1: self-adjustment of the pinion gear shaft
Answer_2: rigidity between the elements of the gear train
Answer_3: efficient distribution of oil to the various elements of the gear train
Answer_4: equal distribution of the load among the various elements of the gear train

Question_Title: The steam drum in a D-type marine boiler __________.
Answer_1: maintains circulation by forcing steam bubbles downward in  the generating tubes
Answer_3: provides a space for moisture to separate from the steam
Answer_4: acts as a receptacle for heavy suspended solids in boiler feedwater

Question_Title: Which of the flexible coupling types listed is used in most turbine reduction gear installations?
When two or more boilers provide steam flow to a common main steam line, each boiler main steam line shall be fitted with a main steam stop valve and a/an __________.

Which of the conditions listed could cause steam formation  in the economizer?
Answer_2: Sudden increase in the firing rate.
Answer_3: Soot buildup on the gill rings.
Answer_4: An open main feed pump recirculating line.

Question_Title: In which of the following lube oil lines should you expect  to find an illuminated sight glass (bull's-eye)?

Fresh water accumulating in the reduction gear sump may be  directly attributed to a/an __________.
Before using a boiler compressed air soot blower system, you should __________.
Answer_3: decrease the forced draft fan speed
Answer_4: drain the soot blower pneumatic operating lines

Question_Title: The pinion gears used in main propulsion reduction gear mechanisms are generally constructed of __________.
Which of the listed conditions causes shrinkage in boiler water levels?
In main propulsion systems, which metal is used in the construction of the shafts for a main reduction gear unit?
The effects of shrink and swell on boiler water levels can  be minimized by __________.
Answer_2: rapidly opening and closing the throttles during maneuvering
Answer_3: avoiding rapid opening and closing of the throttles while answering bells
Answer_4: installing an automatic single-element feedwater regulator

Question_Title: In marine articulated double reduction divided power path gear sets, the first and second reduction gears are usually of fabricated construction.  Why are the gear teeth usually cut in a temperature controlled room?
Answer_2: To prevent ambient conditions from affecting the machining  process.
Answer_3: To control the size of the journals.
Answer_4: To control stress in the webbing.

Question_Title: The superheater vents should always be open when __________.
Answer_3: lighting off or securing the boiler
Answer_4: the water level is lower than normal

Question_Title: Which of the following statements defines the term 'axial float' in reference to reduction gears?
Answer_1: The gears are not subject to excessive tooth loads due to mismatching of the journal bearing halves.
Answer_2: The gears are double-helical and axial thrust is eliminated.
Answer_3: The gears are capable of free motion, neither supporting nor being supported radially by other gears.
Answer_4: The gears are capable of free motion, neither supporting nor being supported axially by other gears.

Question_Title: The scavenging air for soot blowers is supplied by the __________.
Which of the following represents one of the designed functions of reduction gears?
Answer_1: Change rotary motion into linear motion.
Answer_2: Combine multiple speed inputs into a single low speed output.
Answer_3: To amplify low speed to high speed.
Answer_4: Utilize a single engine input and convert to multiple propeller output.

Question_Title: When securing the main engine, which of the listed procedures should be carried out to remove or reduce condensation from the interior of the main reduction gear  casing?
Answer_1: Circulate oil until oil and gear casing have reached ambient temperatures.
Answer_2: Continue to operate the lube oil purifier until there is no water discharge.
Answer_3: Continue to operate the lube oil cooler and rotate the engine with the turning gear.

Question_Title: In a gravity lube oil system, a sight glass is installed in a line near the operating platform.  This line connects the __________.
Answer_1: bottom of the gravity tank and the lube oil headers
Answer_2: bottom of the gravity tank and the sump
Answer_3: gravity tank overflow and the lube oil headers
Answer_4: gravity tank overflow and the sump

Question_Title: A Kingsbury, or pivot shoe type thrust bearing, can bear much greater loads per square inch of working surface than  can parallel surface bearings because provisions are made in the Kingsbury bearing __________.
Answer_1: for adjusting the filler piece thickness behind the pivotal-shoes to give a more accurate fit
Answer_2: for automatically adjusting clearances to the correct value when wear occurs
Answer_3: for the shoes to tilt slightly, thereby allowing the formation of a wedge shaped oil film under a thrust load
Answer_4: to allow the shoes to pivot and remain parallel with the collar when thrust loads are applied

Question_Title: If saltwater leaks into and contaminates the main lubricating oil system, which of the following remedial actions should be taken?
Answer_1: Locate the leak and seal it off when time permits.
Answer_2: Disengage the jacking gear and allow contaminated oil to cool to engine room temperature.
Answer_3: Secure the engines and prevent the circulation of contaminated oil.
Answer_4: Seal off the leak and promptly remove all contaminated oil  from steel parts and surfaces.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the principle  of operation of the Kingsbury type thrust bearing?
Answer_1: A flat film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a wedge shaped oil film.
Answer_2: A flat film of oil can carry heavier loads than a wedge shaped oil film.
Answer_3: A wedge shaped film of oil absorbs less heat than a flat oil film.
Answer_4: A wedge shaped film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a flat oil film.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the function of the center groove machined on a double-helical gear?
Answer_1: It allows the gears slight axial movement without gear damage.
Answer_2: It allows a path for oil to escape regardless of the direction of rotation.
Answer_3: It prevents excessive axial thrust loads from developing on the teeth.
Answer_4: It is used to distribute oil to the gear teeth.

Question_Title: As the rate of combustion is increased in a boiler, more steam is generated because the __________.
Answer_2: weight rate of hot gas flow increases

Question_Title: By which of the following means can rotating parts of the main reduction gear be examined?

Answer_1: be opened to remove condensate, and then closed when the first burner is lit
Answer_2: be closed until just before line pressure is reached, and then given a short blow period
Answer_3: be closed until after the air cock is closed, and then opened until the boiler is placed on line
Answer_4: remain open or partially open until steam blows through the lines, and then the valves should be closed

Question_Title: The maintenance of reduction gear units is principally concerned with attention to keeping the  __________.
Answer_1: reduction ratio constant between the speed of the turbine and the speed of the driven element
Answer_2: upper half of the gear casing secured to the lower half
Answer_3: gears supplied with clean oil at the proper operating pressure and temperature
Answer_4: drive gears aligned with drive shaft

Question_Title: After steam has been raised and a boiler is being placed on the line, the superheater vent can be closed when __________.
Answer_1: main and auxiliary steam line drains are opened
Answer_2: the boiler steam stops have been warmed up
Answer_3: boiler pressure is 5 psi above line pressure
Answer_4: the boiler is supplying auxiliary steam

Question_Title: Which immediate action should you take when the temperature of one shaft bearing increases above its normal operating temperature?
Answer_1: Stop the unit and carefully inspect the bearing.
Answer_2: Stop the unit and replace the bearing.
Answer_3: Check the bearing for proper lubrication.
Answer_4: Check for proper water circulation to the lube oil coolers.

Question_Title: When a boiler is up to pressure and is being placed on the  line, you should secure the __________.
Which of the following problems is likely to occur if the lube oil level in the sump is too high?
Answer_3: The main engine could not be operated at full speed.

Question_Title: Which of the listed conditions can cause excessively high superheater outlet steam temperature in an automated boiler?
Answer_1: High water level in the steam drum.
Answer_2: Excessive heat transfer in the control desuperheater.
Answer_4: A malfunction of the windbox airflow transmitter.

Question_Title: Sludge tanks are used in an oil lubricating system to receive __________.
Answer_1: makeup oil that is to be added to the system after settling
Answer_2: foreign liquid matter, discharged from the lube oil purifier or the stripping pump
Answer_3: bilge slops that can be reclaimed after clarification
Answer_4: all of the oil that passes through the lube oil coolers

Question_Title: On a boiler equipped with an uncontrolled interdeck superheater, reducing the feedwater temperature to the steam drum will cause the superheater outlet temperature to __________.
Dirt and/or metallic particles in a reduction gear  lubricating oil system may cause which of the following problems to occur?
In herringbone helical gear sets, the tooth contact loading __________.
Answer_1: is both a sliding and rolling action
Answer_2: is distributed over several teeth simultaneously
Answer_3: is distributed between two opposing helices

Question_Title: A cloudy or milky appearing lube oil sample, taken from the main lubricating oil system could be caused by __________.
Answer_1: insufficient cooling water to the lube oil cooler
Answer_2: excessive cooling water to the lube oil cooler

Question_Title: Reduction gears on main propulsion turbines are double helical cut to __________.
Answer_4: reduce the size and weight of the bull gear

Question_Title: The steam generating capacity of a boiler depends upon the  __________.
Answer_2: relative size of tubes and downcomers

Question_Title: In a disk type lubricating oil centrifuge __________.
Answer_1: the centrifuge driving gears are lubricated by the reclaimed oil as it leaves the bowl
Answer_2: all dirt and sludge are discharged with the cooling water
Answer_3: sealing water must never be supplied until after oil is fed to the unit
Answer_4: deterioration of the bowl ring gasket will cause the purifier to lose its water seal

Question_Title: Under otherwise normal steaming conditions, an abnormally high temperature at the superheater outlet of a single furnace boiler would indicate __________.
Answer_1: poor heat transfer in feedwater heaters
Answer_4: excessive steam supply to fuel oil heaters

Question_Title: Main reduction and pinion gears are double helically cut to __________.
Answer_2: decrease reduction gear radial bearing loads
Answer_3: increase tooth deflection at high speeds
Answer_4: decrease the number of teeth in contact

Question_Title: When answering a full astern bell from half ahead, the superheater outlet temperature on a single furnace boiler will __________.
Answer_1: increase sharply with the increased firing rate
Answer_2: decrease due to the increase steam volume used
Answer_3: decrease momentarily and then increase proportionately with load demand

Question_Title: The purpose of the pressure control disk installed in the multi-nozzle soot blower, as shown in the illustration, is  to __________.
Answer_1: control the pressure exerted on the steam valve disk when the cam secures the steam supply
Answer_2: reduce the steam supply pressure to the proper soot blower  operating pressure
Answer_3: control the pressure exerted on the valve spring retainer
Answer_4: increase the pressure in the steam supply line for proper soot blower operation

Question_Title: Most main reduction gear units employ double helical cut gears, rather than single helical cut gears, because double helical cut gears __________.
Answer_1: eliminate the need for a turbine dummy piston
Answer_2: eliminate the need for spherically seated bearings

Question_Title: Lube oil temperature leaving the lube oil coolers is regulated by throttling the __________.

Answer_1: increase in the quality of superheated steam
Answer_3: decrease in the degree of superheat
Answer_4: decrease in the quality of steam entering the superheater

Question_Title: The purpose of the main reduction gears is to __________.
Answer_1: transmit vibration and thrust to the ship's hull
Answer_2: reduce high turbine RPM to an efficient propeller RPM
Answer_3: reduce engine room noise levels during high speed operations
Answer_4: provide a means of reversing the main engines in an emergency

Question_Title: If a tube should leak in an operating main steam turbine lube oil cooler, the water will not immediately contaminate the oil because the __________.
Answer_2: plug type bypass valve will open
Answer_3: cooling pump would automatically shut off
Answer_4: oil pressure is greater than the water pressure

Question_Title: An air vent is installed on some reduction gear casings to  __________.
Answer_1: avoid the accumulation of flammable oil vapors
Answer_3: admit cooling air to the gearing

Question_Title: During high speed operation of the main turbine propulsion  unit, the heat absorbed by the lubricating oil is removed by the __________.
Which of the following bearings is designed to take loads applied to the axis of the shaft?
